alert.note: Alert for Eastern Roosevelt; Northern Phillips; Northern Valley; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 07 at 9:20AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following areas, Central and Southeast Phillips, Central and Southern Valley, Daniels, Dawson, Eastern Roosevelt, Garfield, McCone, Northern Phillips, Northern Valley, Petroleum, Prairie, Richland, Sheridan, Southwest Phillips, Western Roosevelt and Wibaux. * WHEN...Through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Several days in a row of Severe Weather, including storms producing heavy rains over a short period of time, combined with the current deep moist atmosphere over northeast Montana primes the region for another day of Severe Thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall. Water loaded ground conditions only exacerbate the concerns that runoff will be excessive with storms this afternoon through Friday morning and could quickly lead to Flash Flooding in areas experiencing these torrential rainfalls. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Roosevelt; Northern Phillips; Northern Valley; Southwest Phillips
